pr_title: Add close method to Helix lock

timeline.bodyText: I suggest making this interface AutoClosable, then you implement close() naturally.
timeline.author: jiajunwang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -49,4 +49,9 @@
    * false if the user is not the lock owner or the lock doesn't have a owner
    */
   boolean isCurrentOwner();
+
+  /**
+   * Close the lock and release resources
+   */
+  void close();

replies.bodyText: As discussed offline, to avoid unexpected close of the lock, we will not implement AutoClosable interface for now.
replies.author: mgao0

timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline. Won't unlock the lock inside close(), but will check to make sure the lock is unlocked when the user calls close().

timeline.bodyText: So we would expect lock users to explicitly call this one? This is a bit unintuitive, when put together with the other APIs that are intended for lock purpose only.
timeline.author: zhangmeng916
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -49,4 +49,9 @@

    */
   boolean isCurrentOwner();
+
+  /**
+   * Close the lock and release resources
+   */
+  void close();

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline, for now we will let user to explicitly call the close method, since we cannot determine all the use cases where we should close the lock right now. After we have a clearer picture of all the features, we can try to do this for our users.
